statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Cent. Connecticut St. 63, St. Francis, NY 50
article.headline: Cent. Connecticut St. 63, St. Francis, NY 50
article.linkText: Cent. Connecticut St. 63, St. Francis, NY 50
article.story: NEW YORK -- David Simmons scored 11 points and had a career-high 14 rebounds for his fifth career double-double to lead Central Connecticut State to a 63-50 victory over St. Francis (N.Y.) in the Northeast Conference opener on Thursday night. Shemik Thompson scored 17 points to lead the Blue Devils (2-3), who have won nine straight against the Terriers (1-5). Central Connecticut State went 8-for-8 from the free throw line in the final 1:30 after building a second half lead. The Blue Devils scored the first seven points of the second half and held St. Francis scoreless for the first 5:40. Central Connecticut State's Joe Efese and Ross Pentland scored on consecutive layups for a 40-29 lead with 10:48 left in the game. Efese scored 12 points and Joe Seymore added 10 points for the Blue Devils. Ricky Cadell led St. Francis with 19 points and Akeem Bennett added 10 points.
